Dialogue:
HW: Hello!
CA: Hello!
HW: What is your favorite food?
CA: Ramen. How about you, <HW>?
HW: Sushi. What flavor of ramen do you like?
CA: Soy sauce. Sushi is good too.
HW: Soy sauce is nice. I like salt flavor.
CA: Do you have any favorite stores here?
HW: Afuri has good salt ramen.
CA: Is it in Kanagawa?
HW: It should be. It's a nationwide chain.
CA: I'll look for it nearby.
HW: It's a good shop. Try Raoh's yuzu salt flavor ramen too.
CA: I'll get it at the store.
HW: It's only sold in winter.
CA: Limited-time offer. Yuzu is a winter fruit.
HW: Yes. It would be great if they sold it all year.
CA: I'm craving shio ramen now.
HW: Shio ramen is light and delicious.
CA: I'd like to visit ramen shops in Japan after the pandemic.
HW: I'd like to visit the top ramen shops someday.
CA: Great idea.
HW: There are huge lines, so it takes time.
CA: The top-ranked shops are in places like Tokyo?
HW: They are scattered across prefectures.
CA: Tokyo is a branch?
HW: Yes, masters have branches in Tokyo.
CA: Interesting to see what the master is like.
HW: Their photos are in ramen magazines.
CA: The boss can check that too.
HW: Collaboration products with famous ramen shops are easy to get now.
CA: Certainly. Let's talk again soon.
HW: Yes, let's talk again.

HW: Hello  
CA: Hello  
HW: What is your favorite drink?  
CA: Coffee, shochu, and sake. What about you?  
HW: I prefer tea without caffeine. I don't usually drink alcohol.  
CA: Understood.  
HW: I often have decaf coffee, rooibos tea, or herbal teas.  
CA: Cutting down on caffeine can be good for you.  
HW: I have a weak stomach, so I limit caffeine. Any good coffee tips?  
CA: Try black coffee with white chocolate.  
HW: I'll give that a try.  
CA: They pair well together.  
HW: White chocolate might be gentler on my stomach.  
CA: Caffeine can affect the stomach.  
HW: Yes, especially on an empty stomach. Warm drinks are better.  
CA: Got it.  
HW: Maybe it's just my stomach. Decaf means non-caffeine.  
CA: Correct.  
HW: I'll keep that in mind. Non-caffeine is good for many people.  
CA: It has benefits.  
HW: It's both healthy and tasty.  
CA: Do you have a cat?  
HW: I'm allergic, but I like watching cat videos.  
CA: I noticed a cute cat icon on Slack.  
HW: Cats with pink noses or white socks are cute.  
CA: Interesting.  
HW: Check out the Mochineko channel on YouTube. Thanks! Let's talk again.  
CA: Acknowledged. Let's talk again.

HW: Thank you in advance.
EU: Nice to meet you, please take care of me!
HW: It's a perfect day for sports, isn't it? Do you have any sports you're good at?
EU: Actually, I'm clumsy with sports, but I like swimming. How about you?
HW: Swimming, huh! Today is perfect for swimming! I play tennis as a hobby.
EU: Tennis is cool! It's the sport they call the gentleman's game.
HW: Yes, that's right. Skilled people have a gentlemanly form.
EU: It seems too hot to handle in the summer, you might collapse. And it involves hard movements.
HW: It's the kind of temperature today that makes you want to swim in the sea rather than play tennis. Have you gone swimming this year?
EU: About the only thing I did was go to the local public pool with my child. Originally, we had planned to go to the river today.
HW: The public pool looks fun!
EU: Because of the coronavirus situation, it wasn't too crowded, so that was good.
HW: It's great that it wasn't crowded.
EU: A private pool, how enviable!!
HW: When I was a child, there was a time when I arrived at the public pool first thing in the morning and it was almost like having it all to myself. It left an impression on me because it felt different from usual.
EU: Wow! Does "first thing in the morning" mean around 8 o'clock?
HW: I think it was probably about that time. After that, I swam with a friend and ate ice cream. Don't you think there are a lot of ice cream vending machines at the public pool?
EU: Oh yes, there's an ice cream vending machine! Cup noodles and such are also really delicious at that time!
HW: You get hungry after swimming, don't you?
EU: Everything I eat is really delicious. Ah, I'm starting to feel like swimming. I'm sorry for talking only about myself.
HW: I like listening to people, so it's okay.
EU: You're so kind. Next time, I'd love to hear more about tennis.
HW: If it's about unusual tennis plays, I can always talk about them!
EU: Rare play! I imagined something like a comic on my own and couldn't help but laugh.
HW: I'm having a good time with my tennis club friends. Could it make for an essay comic? Hahaha.
EU: You're in a club! How serious! Could it be that you're an expert?
HW: This is a beginner's tennis club that often makes funny mistakes. Let's talk again sometime soon!
EU: I also want to join in. Please let me talk with you again!
HW: Yes! Thank you very much!
EU: Thank you very much!

HW: Thank you in advance!
IM: You're welcome.

HW: It's almost dinnertime!
IM: What's on the menu?

HW: We plan to make paella with a kit from the supermarket.
IM: Paella sounds good. I like seafood dishes.

HW: It's easy to make with frozen seafood mix and seasoning.
IM: I usually make seafood pasta with the mix.

HW: Seafood pasta sounds good! What's for dinner tonight?
IM: Leftover curry from yesterday.

HW: Nice! Curry gets better the next day, right?
IM: Yes, and maybe seafood curry would be nice too.

HW: I'll try making seafood curry next time!
IM: I've never made it before and I'm a bit anxious.

HW: It will be fine. Just add the seafood mix at the end.
IM: I'll try. Do you cook often?

HW: I cook daily but only the usual dishes with the ingredients I have.
IM: Impressive.

HW: I cook only when necessary. Do you cook or bake?
IM: I don't cook much but want to try.

HW: Sounds good! I want to make a banana dessert with extra bananas at home.
IM: Banana sweets sound good. Any recommendations?

HW: I want to try banana bread with bananas and pancake mix.
IM: That sounds simple and tasty.

HW: Yes. I'll make it again when butter prices go down.
IM: Is butter expensive now?

HW: Yes, the cost of living has made ingredients expensive.
IM: I'll buy finished products until it gets cheaper.

HW: I will too. Let's talk again!
IM: Sure, let's do that.

HW: Thank you in advance.
IM: Understood.
HW: I'm watching anime right now. Any recommendations?
IM: Demon Slayer.
HW: Demon Slayer is interesting. Anime or manga?
IM: Both, started with anime.
HW: Must have taken a lot of time. I've only seen the anime.
IM: Yes, but it was enjoyable.
HW: The animation was beautiful.
IM: Yes, the visuals are impressive. Do you watch often?
HW: When I have time, I binge-watch.
IM: I also watch a couple of seasons when I can.
HW: Binge-watching is fun. Do you eat anything while watching?
IM: Yes, potato chips.
HW: Potato chips are good. What flavor?
IM: Lightly salted and limited edition.
HW: Many varieties. I recently had thick-cut ridged chips, delicious.
IM: Thick-cut chips sound tasty. I'll try them. They make your hands dirty.
HW: True. It makes other tasks difficult.
IM: Yes, I touched my smartphone, it was a problem.
HW: Inconvenient.
IM: Now I use wet tissues.
HW: Practical. Thanks for sharing.
IM: You're welcome.

HW: Thank you in advance.
IM: You're welcome.
HW: It's hot every day, isn't it?
IM: Yes, it is. How are you staying cool?
HW: I was curious about those new cool rings. I've been using a cool towel that gets chilly when wet.
IM: What is a cool ring?
HW: It's made from a material that freezes below 28Â°C and doesn't wet your clothes.
IM: That sounds convenient.
HW: Cool towels wet the neck, but cool rings avoid that issue.
IM: Do you have other concerns about the heat?
HW: Carrying many items during summer travel is common.
IM: Carrying lots of luggage can be inconvenient.
HW: True. But carrying your favorite drink in a bottle is great too.
IM: Do you have any drink recommendations?
HW: I drink jasmine tea or flavored tea powder.
IM: What flavors are available?
HW: Supermarkets have apple and vanilla flavored tea powder.
IM: Noted. Any other preferences for drinks?
HW: Water is healthy. Do you prefer hard or soft water?
IM: I find hard water unpleasant.
HW: Hard water is unsuitable for tea.
IM: It is said to be good for cooking.
HW: I didn't know that.
IM: Water usage varies depending on the type.
HW: I'll research a bit.
IM: Learning more could be helpful.
HW: I enjoyed this conversation. Thank you.
IM: Thank you as well.

HW: Thank you in advance!
IM: You're welcome.
HW: Do you like animals?
IM: Yes, I have pets at home.
HW: What kind of animal do you have?
IM: I have a stray cat.
HW: What color is your cat?
IM: It's milk tea color. Are pets not allowed?
HW: I have a cat allergy, so I can't keep one.
IM: I see, that must be difficult.
HW: I limit myself to just watching cats on TV shows. Is living with a cat fun?
IM: It's fun, but taking care of pets can be challenging.
HW: What kind of things are difficult?
IM: The biggest difficulty is not being able to travel.
HW: Is traveling still difficult even with water dispensers and automatic feeders?
IM: I didn't know those existed.
HW: I saw it on Amazon.
IM: I might be able to travel if I get one. I haven't used Amazon much.
HW: Is your cat already big?
IM: Yes, he is quite large and chubby.
HW: Big cats have a different kind of cuteness compared to kittens.
IM: Yes, the feeling of holding a big cat is different.
HW: Life with a cat seems fun.
IM: You can also watch them on YouTube. Do you watch cat videos?
HW: Sometimes, I watch cat videos. There are also various cat toys.
IM: They get bored with toys quickly, don't they?
HW: That's a problem.
IM: We have many unused toys at home. This is also challenging.
HW: Thank you for the conversation. Let's talk again.
IM: Please do it again.

HW: Thank you in advance.
IM: You're welcome.
HW: It's hot every day, isn't it?
IM: It is indeed hot. I enjoy summer.
HW: You like summer, don't you! Why is summer your favorite season?
IM: Summer activities like going to the beach or mountains are enjoyable.
HW: Indeed! I also love seeing the mountains lush and green in summer! I love how it looks like a picture with the cumulonimbus clouds.
IM: The summer sky does look picturesque.
HW: I like to travel to summer resorts and mountains, but I haven't been able to go recently. Have you been on any trips lately?
IM: Not yet, but I plan to return to my hometown for Obon.
HW: That sounds exciting! Is your hometown in the mountains? Or by the sea?
IM: My hometown has a lot of mountains.
HW: I see! Living near the mountains is lovely, isn't it?
IM: It is. I would like to move back there in the future. Do you have any plans for this summer?
HW: I was planning to travel during Obon, but I'm waiting to see how the COVID-19 situation develops.
IM: The rise in COVID-19 cases is concerning.
HW: That's right. A lot has changed since the spread of COVID-19 compared to before.
IM: Many things have changed. My lessons' recital got canceled.
HW: That's a shame. What kind of lessons are you taking?
IM: I've been playing the piano since I was a student.
HW: That's wonderful! How many years have you been doing it?
IM: Nearly 10 years. It's disappointing to miss the annual recital.
HW: You've been continuing for 10 years! It's great to have goals every year.
IM: Thank you. Is there something you continue to do?
HW: Sometimes I attend cooking classes, though I do so irregularly.
IM: How long have you been going to cooking classes?
HW: I attend occasionally, not regularly.
IM: I see. I cannot cook.
HW: Thank you. Let's talk again if we have the chance.
IM: Thank you.
